intro: Borreria capillaris, commonly known as redroot false mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, reddish stems and small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Borreria capillaris is often found in dry, disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
